Digital Pedagogy: Theory and Concepts

The RAT model is a tool that helps teachers evaluate how technology affects their teaching and learning, based on three goals: replace the traditional with technology, amplify the technology usage, or transform the learning with technology.

Finally, the SAMR model is a guide for educators to use technology to improve teaching and learning, based on four levels of gradual development in using the technology in teaching:

  • 1) substitute, where the traditional tool is directly replaced with a digital one;
  • 2) augmentation, in which a digital tool is used to enhance a task;
  • 3) modification, where the digital tool is used to change a task; and
  • 4) redefinition, where digital tools make it possible to achieve something previously impossible.
